CatDescriptText: Miss Nona Heaps, job hunter, Aliquippa and Mrs. Mercedes Oakes, housewife, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 21, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you approve of the United States testing nuclear weapons in the atmosphere?"  Ms. Heaps' answer reads: "I don't approve.  This will eventually affect our health and our lives through the fallout."  Mrs. Oakes' answer reads: "No, I don't. We can see how it's affecting the weather, and soon it may affect the people, too."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Nona Heaps wearing light colored sleeveless shirt, standing with arms crossed in front of the Brass Rail restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Mercedes Oakes wearing striped shirt dress with patterned bodice, standing in front of the Brass Rail restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown
